last_episode_to_air.name: The Journey
last_episode_to_air.overview: Stoney is unable to ride at the World Championship Rodeo because of a badly injured hand.  Desperate for money to send to his folks and hitting bottom, he takes a job delivering horses to the slaughter house. One of the horses turns out to be Megaton.  Stoney takes a good hard look at where he's headedâ€”and the slaughter house isn't it.

name: Stoney Burke
overview: Stoney Burke is an American western television series broadcast on ABC from October 1, 1962 until May 20, 1963. Six years before the premiere of his CBS crime drama, Hawaii Five-0, Jack Lord starred in the title role.

episodes.name: Pilot
episodes.overview:
Harland Bristol is the reigning saddle bronc champ. Getting ready to ride Megaton, Harland is critically injured when the rank bronc rears up and slams him into the chute wall.

Unfortunately, Stoney Burke was helping out - holding Megaton's head. Harland's brother Cody and his best friend E.J. Stoker blame Stoney for Harland's death.

The episode introduces us to the principal characters, establishes themes sewn throughout the series, and gives hints to the eventual outcome.

Thematic examples include forgiveness; Cody and E.J. go from wanting Stoney hurt for Harland's death to being his best friends and constant companions.

We learn what a sleaze the character of Ves Painter is, and the attendant friction - approach/avoidance - represented by Ves and Stoney's difficult relationship.

Stoney falls for Hamilton's girl (much younger than he) and seems willing to give it all up for her. She, however is smarter - or more mature than Stoney and realizes that if he does not go for the buckle -

episodes.name: Fight Night
episodes.overview:
An old political fight between two small-county commissioners causes the delay of Stoney and the rodeo from getting to the next venue, resulting in the death of one of the cowboys. The Police Commissioner wants his charity boxing match to run on the same night as the Health Commissioner's charity rodeo.

Thugs in the employ of one of the boxers pays Ves Painter to help disrupt the rodeo.

episodes.name: Child of Luxury
episodes.overview: Hell's fury is unleashed when Stoney scorns the affections of a spoiled rich girl whose daddy is the town's power broker.

episodes.name: Point of Honor
episodes.overview: Stoney and E.J. notice that local boy Soames Hewitt is drunk, just moments before he is scheduled to ride a dangerous brahma bull.

episodes.name: The Mob Riders
episodes.overview: Local teen-agers become upset when they discover that the old arena they use for stock car races will be converted into a rodeo IF Stoney Burke agrees to perform there.

episodes.name: A Matter of Pride
episodes.overview: Rodeo rider Miller Hill ties himself so tightly to a brahma bull he is riding that he ends up being killed by the animal.  His family refuse to accept money that Stoney collects to help them in their hour of need.

episodes.name: Sidewinder
episodes.overview: Stoney is hit with a lawsuit when the bronc he is riding crashes thru a fence and injures a woman spectator, Loreen Julian.

episodes.name: The Scavenger
episodes.overview: Stoney's friendship with Ves is put to the test when Ves is jailed for murder.  When a money clip belonging to the dead man is found in Ves' car even Stoney begins to have his doubts.  A  street bum holds the key, or in this case, a watch, to Ves'   salvation.  But first,Stoney and the boys must find him.

episodes.name: Cousin Eunice
episodes.overview: Cloris Leachman plays Eunice Stocker, E.J.'s cousin.  She wants E.J. to train her to be a rodeo trick rider.

episodes.name: Gold Plated Maverick
episodes.overview: A rich man, Byron Latimer, wants Stoney to help him tame his out of control teen-age son, David.

episodes.name: Death Rides a Pale Horse
episodes.overview: Stoney must compete against an emotionally disturbed bronc rider.

episodes.name: Webb of Fear
episodes.overview: Stoney experiences a series of accidents at the rodeo arena.  He then begins receiving threatening phone calls.  Ves becomes convinced that the ""accidents"" were not accidental afterall.

episodes.name: Point of Entry
episodes.overview: Stoney and the boys cross into Mexico for some rest and relaxation.  Stoney falls for a mysterious woman(Antoinette Bower).  Unfortunately, she only wants to use Stoney as an alibi for her involvement in the assassination of a European diplomat.

episodes.name: Weapons Man
episodes.overview: During an exhibition of Indian archery, a government official is killed.

episodes.name: Kelly's Place
episodes.overview: The boys take Stoney to a fancy club for his birthday. He meets the owner and singer who is having a few problems with her boyfriend and partner. Will spending time with Stoney help put things back where they belong?

episodes.name: Kincaid
episodes.overview: Sgt. Andy Kincaid runs a center for boys who keep getting into trouble. The rodeo comes to the city and Stoney and the kids are asked to help with ticket sales.  One of the kids thinks it's a great ideaâ€”he's planning on keeping the money for himself.

episodes.name: A Girl Named Amy
episodes.overview: Amy Jensen is in charge of the Caldwell College Student Rodeo.  She volunteered for the job because she's got a very serious crush on family friend Stoney. Amy has visions of wedding bells, but Stoney may have other ideas.

episodes.name: Tigress by the Tail
episodes.overview: Spoiled Donna Weston wants it all but is so far in debt she can't see daylight.  Her late father once saved Stoney's life and he feels obligated to help Donna, but she's more than he can afford.

episodes.name: The Test
episodes.overview: When the shoot gate won't open, Stoney gets trampled by a bronc. He should only have a concussion, but he can't move his legs. The doctors can't find a reason for it, but it keeps him from the National Finals and may keep him from riding ever again.

episodes.name: The Journey
episodes.overview: Stoney is unable to ride at the World Championship Rodeo because of a badly injured hand.  Desperate for money to send to his folks and hitting bottom, he takes a job delivering horses to the slaughter house. One of the horses turns out to be Megaton.  Stoney takes a good hard look at where he's headedâ€”and the slaughter house isn't it.
